text: Chhatari is a Town in Bulandshahr district in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India. ==History== Chhatari was a jagir during British India. It was owned by Nawabs of Lalkhani, a Badgujar Rajput community. ===Nawabs of Chhatari=== * Nawab Mardan Ali Khan * Nawab Mehmud Ali Khan * Kunwar Luft Ali Khan * Kunwar Abdul Ali Khan IV * Nawab Abdul Samad Khan (1862-1922) * Nawab Hafiz Sir Ahmad Said Khan I (1888-1981) ==Amenities== There are two nationalized bank, one degree college, a sub post office and also have an aggro-products trading center for farmers residing near town. ==Demographics== India census, Chhatari had a population of 15786. Males constitute 54% of the population and females 4%. Chhatari has an average literacy rate of 10%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 10% and female literacy of 10%. 19% of the population is under 6 years of age. ==Notable people== * Muhammad Ahmad Said Khan Chhatari "Nawab of Chhatari", a prominent Muslim League politician, and last Prime Minister of the Hyderabad State.^ People of India Uttar Pradesh Volume XLII Part Two edited by A Hasan & J C Das ==References== Category:Cities and towns in Bulandshahr district Category:Zamindari estates
title: Chhatari
